tasks: Create a simple wireframe of a login form using the 8-point grid system to improve UI Craft & Visual Design (score: 19/100)
Write down 5 usability heuristics from the nngroup.com article and explain how they apply to your current design work (score: 15/100)
Practice Hick’s Law by designing a simple navigation menu with varying numbers of options, noting how it affects user behavior
Redesign the login form wireframe from Week 1 using Aesthetic-Usability Effect principles to improve visual appeal (score: 19/100)
Conduct a self-assessment of your current UX Fundamentals knowledge, identifying areas where you need improvement and creating a plan to address them
Create a simple user flow diagram for a hypothetical app, focusing on clear navigation and minimal cognitive load
Apply Tesler’s Law by designing an interactive element with varying levels of complexity, noting how it affects user engagement
Develop a basic product strategy document for your hypothetical app, outlining key features and target audience
Create a mockup of a simple error page using the 8-point grid system to improve UI Craft & Visual Design (score: 19/100)
Design an advanced interactive element using Hick’s Law principles, such as a dropdown menu with varying numbers of options
Create a comprehensive product strategy document for your hypothetical app, including market research and competitive analysis
Conduct a usability test on your redesigned login form wireframe from Week 1, documenting user feedback and iterating on the design

resources.readup: As an Explorer UX designer, you have the power to shape the user experience of innovative products and services. By leveraging your skills in user research, visual design, and collaboration, you can uncover new insights and create intuitive interfaces that delight users and drive business success.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Hick's Law and its Application in UX Design
topics.summary: Hick's Law is a fundamental principle in UX design that affects the speed of user interactions. Understanding how to apply it will help you create more efficient and effective interfaces.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing websites or applications using Hick's Law and identify areas for improvement
Design an interactive prototype with micro-interactions, applying Hick's Law to optimize user experience
Conduct a usability study on a specific task, measuring the impact of Hick's Law on user performance

topics.name: Applying Tesler’s Law in Visual Design
topics.summary: Tesler’s Law states that users are more likely to remember information when it is presented in a clear and concise manner. Understanding how to apply this law will help you create more effective visual designs.
practice_points: Create 3 wireframes with clear typography, color schemes, and spacing, applying Tesler’s Law
Design an icon set using Tesler’s Law principles, ensuring clarity and memorability
Analyze 5 existing logos or brand identities, identifying areas where Tesler’s Law can be applied for improvement

topics.name: Conducting User Research with the Zeigarnik Effect in Mind
topics.summary: The Zeigarnik Effect states that users are more likely to remember uncompleted tasks. Understanding how to apply this effect will help you design more effective user research studies.
practice_points: Conduct 2 interviews using the Zeigarnik Effect framework, identifying areas where users feel incomplete or unfinished
Design a survey with open-ended questions, applying the Zeigarnik Effect to encourage users to share their thoughts and feelings
Analyze 3 existing user research studies, identifying how the Zeigarnik Effect was applied to inform design decisions

insights.brief: Explorer's UX skills need improvement to effectively guide users through the design process.
insights.detailed: The current score of 15/100 indicates that Explorer lacks a solid understanding of fundamental UX principles, such as user-centered design and wireframing. This results in a subpar experience for users who interact with their designs.
actionable: Take an online course or workshop to improve understanding of UX fundamentals
Read books and articles on UX design to stay up-to-date
Join online communities or forums to learn from others in the field

insights.brief: Explorer's UI craft skills are somewhat lacking, resulting in designs that lack visual appeal.
insights.detailed: The current score of 19/100 indicates that Explorer struggles with creating visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces. This can lead to a poor user experience and negatively impact the overall design process.
actionable: Create a portfolio showcasing their best UI designs
Participate in design challenges or hackathons to practice and improve skills
Study the work of other designers and analyze what makes their designs successful

insights.brief: Explorer's user research skills are underdeveloped, leading to designs that don't meet user needs.
insights.detailed: The current score of 31/100 indicates that Explorer could benefit from more extensive user research experience. This would enable them to gather and analyze data to inform design decisions, resulting in a better user experience.
actionable: Take an online course or workshop on user research methods
Participate in user research projects or studies to gain hands-on experience
Read books and articles on user research to deepen understanding of the process

insights.brief: Explorer's product thinking skills are limited, resulting in designs that don't align with business goals.
insights.detailed: The current score of 14/100 indicates that Explorer could benefit from more training on product thinking and strategy. This would enable them to consider the broader context of design decisions and create solutions that meet both user needs and business objectives.
actionable: Read books and articles on product thinking and strategy
Take an online course or workshop on product development
Join online communities or forums to learn from others in the field

insights.brief: Explorer's collaboration and communication skills need improvement to effectively work with teams.
insights.detailed: The current score of 21/100 indicates that Explorer could benefit from more practice in collaboration and communication. This would enable them to effectively convey design ideas, receive feedback, and incorporate it into their designs.
actionable: Join a design team or participate in group projects to gain experience
Take an online course or workshop on effective communication and collaboration
Practice active listening and ask for feedback from peers
